reviews.review_msg: Good Prof. Notes were helpful for assignments, Exam questions built well on assignments and notes. Posted pictures of written notes for those who were unable to be in class. Very flexible with students' course load and extensions.
Pretty Good. Good notes, fair exams, I would take his class again. Has an accent but if you're Chinese or used to listening to Chinese accents, you'll be fine.

Pretty good prof.  Posted slides before class and problem sets after every class.  Midterms and final where mostly based on in class notes and practice questions.   Lots of examples in class so attendance helps understanding a ton.
If you think his class is hard, then its your problem. even with a funky accent the material is so gr 12. all you need to do is read the text and do practice midterm/final to do well
He does have that funky accent,but overall i think the level of difficulty is alright. basically its all like Chem 12 AP
Final was freaking hard especially compared to the midterm

Though he has an accent made of chinese and french, understanding him maybe hard. but he's a nice guy and notes are ok. hw is alright.for mid and final just read text and study from review pkgs. Dr. Ye is funny cuz he accidently made the fire alarm go off once lol

This guy is the worst prof I have had at SFU. His lectures are very difficult to follow, he has a very thick accent. Going for help is useless as he rarely attends his office hours. Going for help after lecture is no better. He quickly brushes you off and at best refers you to the T.A for help. I have no positive things to say about this prof.
An Average prof, has a funky/funny accent that can be extremely funny at times. Tests are fair. He Loves the material hes teaching but doesn't pace himself well and rushes through the end.

He was born in China, grew up in France and then came to Canada. He has an asain/french accent which makes it impossible to understand him. Overall he is really nice and seems to LOVE what he's teaching. Tests are fair and multiple choice. Only downside is the accent.
He seems really nice, but his accent makes him impossible to understand in class. He doesn't  go into much detail for concepts. Tests were all multiple choice.

nice person, willing to help students. watch out his notes come from the textboook. can be hard to understand since his english is not fluent. suprising his 2nd language is french for an azn guy. funny how he always show demos 45s b4 class ends, he always go like " no no no plz dont go" in such an accent.
Nice person
moron
His english was good, tests easy... fairly simple course really.
not good at all .... slept through all his lectures and his explanation is very unclear ... his english is very poor!! THE MIDTERMS AND FINAL R VERY TOUGH!!!
not one of the nicest prof out there, he just copy notes straight from the textbook
his notes are good, cant understand wat he says in class...also not very nice
English is terrible, can't pronounce anything properly, went to him in person; very hard to deal with and not a nice guy at all. Only good thing is his notes are decent.
HE CAN'T SPEAK ENGLISH!!!                                        enough said, BUT, his exams are pretty tough, and he's mean!!!!
No Comments
Gives very thorough notes!
Takes awhile to get used to the accent but he is really helpful when approached in office hours.
so far the tests are not too hard... he has a harsh accent but he is very easy to talk to and compromise with. very easy going. nice guy knows his stuff...pretty good teacher all around
doesn't speak english very well but his helpfulness really makes up for that.  goes really far for his students as well.  pretty easy when compared with other 2nd year classes
Powerpoint notes, but they are unclear.  All exams are multiple choice.  Very hard to understand.

he's been very helpful - he does try hard to teach well. does have an accent and is often incomprehensible but you get used to it in about 2 weeks into the semester.  sometimes rushes through concepts too fast.  though a pretty easy class so far.
Teacher was horrible. Guy can barely speak english and doesn't not care about students at all. Notes are really hard to understand. Avoid this guy!
